conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C, and the task is to predict which container (D or E) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
Points A, B, and C are at the top, each releasing liquid in different colors: blue, yellow, and pink respectively.
Diagonal bars in various colors are present below the points A, B, and C, which might obstruct or redirect the flow.
There are house-shaped containers at the bottom in blue, purple, and gray colors labeled as D and E.

premise: The blue liquid from point A flows downward and encounters a diagonal bar.
conclusion: The diagonal bar directs the blue liquid towards the left.

premise: The yellow liquid from point B flows downward and encounters a diagonal bar.
conclusion: The diagonal bar directs the yellow liquid towards the right.

premise: The pink liquid from point C flows downward and encounters a diagonal bar.
conclusion: The diagonal bar directs the pink liquid further to the right.

premise: The blue liquid from point A flows downward and hits the black slanted barrier.
conclusion: The black slanted barrier changes the direction of the blue liquid to the right.

premise: The yellow liquid from point B flows downward and hits the black slanted barrier.
conclusion: The black slanted barrier changes the direction of the yellow liquid to the right.

premise: The blue and yellow liquids converge at the yellow baffle.
conclusion: The yellow baffle deflects the blue and yellow liquids to the left.

premise: The pink liquid from point C flows downward and encounters the gray barrier.
conclusion: The gray barrier deflects the pink liquid to the left.

premise: The blue and yellow liquids deflected by the yellow baffle flow towards the containers at the bottom.
conclusion: The blue and yellow liquids end up in container E.

premise: The pink liquid deflected by the gray barrier flows towards the containers at the bottom.
conclusion: The pink liquid ends up in container F.

premise: The paths of the liquids and their interactions with barriers and baffles determine their final destinations.
conclusion: The liquid from A separates into container E and F equally; stream B ends in the container E, stream C ends in the container F.
